meanings.definition: Pausing before saying or doing something.
meanings.sent1: She stood hesitating at the edge of the pool before jumping in.
meanings.sent2: He was hesitating to answer the teacher's question.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat hesitatingly in front of the mouse, unsure whether to pounce.
meanings.sent4: The sun peeked out from behind the clouds, hesitatingly shining its light on the field.
meanings.sent5: The child approached the unfamiliar dog hesitatingly, unsure if it was friendly.

meanings.sent1: Her hesitating response indicated her uncertainty about the situation.
meanings.sent2: The hesitant student raised his hand tentatively in class.
meanings.sent3: The hesitant squirrel eyed the nut but was unsure if it was a trap.
meanings.sent4: The hesitant driver inched forward at the intersection, unsure of the right of way.
meanings.sent5: The hesitant shopper browsed the store, unsure of what to buy.

meanings.definition: Delaying or taking time before making a decision or taking action.
meanings.sent1: The hesitating customer took a long time to choose a flavor of ice cream.
meanings.sent2: She was hesitating to sign the contract, wanting to review it one more time.
meanings.sent3: The hesitating squirrel debated whether to cross the road or turn back.
meanings.sent4: The hesitating clouds delayed the start of the outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The hesitating student procrastinated on starting the assignment.
